queries.name: Query 1
queries.query: FIND unified_device as d RETURN COUNT(d) as value

markdown.text:
Welcome to the Device Anomaly Detection Beta!  We appreciate your willingness to give us feedback to help make JupiterOne better for everyone.

This dashboard highlights the data and insights produced by the anomaly detection system (powered by JupiterOne AI).
The system scans the `unified_device` entities in your account, and uses advanced machine learning
algorithms to detect anomalies in that data set.  It combines the raw property values with computed properties
that augment the data with overall graph context.  When an anomaly is found, it is persisted to the graph as
a `device_anomaly` entity, and related to the `unified_device` entity it describes.

widgets.noResultMessage: No anomalies found in your device inventory.
widgets.title: Anomalies Identified

queries.name: Query 1
queries.query: FIND device_anomaly as d that has unified_device RETURN COUNT(d) as value

widgets.description: This widget sorts the device_anomaly entities by their anomalyScore, which indicates the overall degree of anomalousness.
widgets.title: Most Anomalous Devices

queries.name: Query 1
queries.query:
FIND device_anomaly THAT HAS unified_device as device 
RETURN device_anomaly.displayName as anomalyName, device_anomaly.anomalyScore as anomalyScore, device.displayName  as deviceName
ORDER BY device_anomaly.anomalyScore DESC

widgets.description: This widget shows the entire graph structure of how the anomaly_detection_assessment relates to the unified_device through a device_anomaly entity.
widgets.title: Anomaly Detection Assessment

queries.name: Query 1
queries.query:
FIND anomaly_detection_assessment
  THAT IDENTIFIED device_anomaly
  (THAT HAS unified_device)?
RETURN TREE
